\chapter{Installation}
\label{\detokenize{index:installation}}\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
Ensure Python is installed and working on your machine.

\item {} 
{[}Install matplotlib for Python.{]}(\sphinxurl{https://matplotlib.org/users/installing.html})

\item {} 
Run these commands from the Julia prompt:

\end{enumerate}

\section{Time-Series Plots}
\label{\detokenize{ts:time-series-plots}}\label{\detokenize{ts::doc}}\index{plotseis() (built-in function)@\spxentry{plotseis()}\spxextra{built-in function}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ts:plotseis}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{plotseis}}}{\emph{S::SeisData}\sphinxoptional{, \emph{fmt="auto"}, \emph{use\_name=false}, \emph{nxt=5)}}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}


Normalized trace plot of data in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{S}}. Time-series data use lines; irregularly-
sampled data are plotted with circles.
\index{uptimes() (built-in function)@\spxentry{uptimes()}\spxextra{built-in function}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ts:uptimes}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{uptimes}}}{\emph{S::SeisData}\sphinxoptional{, \emph{summed=false}, \emph{fmt="auto"}, \emph{use\_name=false}}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}


Plot uptimes of each channel in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{S}} using filled, colored bars.

If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{summed==true}}, plot uptimes for all channels in S that record timeseries data,
scaled so that y=1 corresponds to 100\% of channels active. Non-timeseries
channels in S are not counted toward the cumulative total in a summed uptime plot.


\subsection{Keywords}
\label{\detokenize{ts:keywords}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fmt=FMT}} formats x-axis labels using C-language \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{strftime}} format string \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{FMT}}. If unspecified, the format is determined by when data in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{S}} start and end.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{use\_name=true}} uses \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{S.name}}, rather than \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{S.id}}, for trace labels.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{n=N}} sets the number of X-axis ticks to N.

\end{itemize}


\section{Time-Frequency Plots}
\label{\detokenize{tf:time-frequency-plots}}\label{\detokenize{tf::doc}}\index{logspec() (built-in function)@\spxentry{logspec()}\spxextra{built-in function}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{tf:logspec}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{logspec}}}{\emph{S::SeisData}, \emph{k::Union\{Int64}, \emph{String\}}\sphinxoptional{, \emph{nx=1024}, \emph{ov=0.5}, \emph{fmin=0.5*fs/nx}, \emph{fmax=0.5*fs}, \emph{fmt="auto"}}}{}
\end{fulllineitems}


Spectrogram of trace number or channel ID \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{k}} with logarithmic scaling of the
y-axis (frequency).


\subsection{Keywords}
\label{\detokenize{tf:keywords}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{nx} window length

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{ov} overlap fraction between adjacent windows

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{fmin} lowest frequency to plot

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{fmax} highest frequency to plot

\end{itemize}
